title: In Ukraine, gamers make the best drone pilots
summary: Now more deadly than any other weapon, drones have changed the face of the fighting between Kyiv and Moscow. Pending a solution to the conflict, Ukraine is focusing on training and recruiting the people who make the best pilots: gamers.

title: Europe takes its time to respond to Trump's tariff offensive
summary: The European Commission still hopes to negotiate with Washington to mitigate the damage that the announced tariff increases would cause. The first wave of retaliations, initially set to take effect on April 1, have been postponed for some until mid-April and for others until mid-May.

title: Guitarist and singer Amadou Bagayoko dies at 70 following an illness
summary: Amadou formed half of the famous music duo Amadou & Mariam, the 'blind couple from Mali.' Their France-based manager Yannick Tardy, who had just spoken to Mariam by phone, said that Amadou was taken to a clinic after feeling fatigued, then died in the afternoon on Friday.

title: Trump extends TikTok deadline another 75 days as US continues to look for a deal
summary: US President Donald Trump on Friday extended the deadline for TikTok to find a non-Chinese buyer or face a ban in the United States, allowing 75 more days to find a solution.

title: US cardinal accused of historical misconduct, sex abuse dies at 94
summary: Theodore McCarrick, the former archbishop of Washington, was suspected of various sexual assaults against minors and young men. Pope Francis, under fire for a growing abuse scandal in the Catholic Church, expelled him from the priesthood in 2019.  A Vatican probe found he had assaulted a teenager five decades earlier.

title: Tariffs: In Savoie, the Dolin House fears for its vermouth sales in the United States
summary: The Chambéry distillery anticipates a 40% jump in the price of its aperitif for American consumers as 70% of its exports head across the Atlantic.

title: Trump and Vance support Marine Le Pen after her conviction
summary: US President Donald Trump called the conviction of French far-right leader Marine Le Pen for embezzlement a 'witch hunt,' while Vice President JD Vance said her ban on running for office was 'not democracy.'

title: China responds to Trump's tariffs with trade measures and a WTO lawsuit
summary: China responded to US President Donald Trump's new customs duties by measures such as imposing the same 34% tariff rate on bilateral trade, expanding export controls and filing a suit with the World Trade Organization.

title: In Taiwan, Mazu, goddess of the sea and Chinese influence
summary: Taiwanese authorities are convinced that the worship surrounding this popular deity is enabling Beijing to spread its ideas in favor of absorbing the island into the mainland.

title: Putin's delay tactics stall talks with US over Ukraine truce
summary: Despite Donald Trump's early concessions to Russia, peace talks have stalled, and the only progress – a deal to halt strikes on infrastructure – remains largely ineffective.

title: UK and France accuse Russian President Putin of delaying Ukraine ceasefire efforts
summary: As Russian forces prepare to launch a new military offensive in the coming weeks, a Kremlin envoy has indicated that outstanding issues are stalling ceasefire talks.

title: Acceleration of Le Pen's appeal undermines principle of equality before the law
summary: The decision to bring the date of far-right leader Marine Le Pen's appeal trial forward to 2026, so that it happens ahead of the 2027 presidential election, raises a series of questions that weaken the judiciary.

title: France urges 'patriotism' from firms after Macron call to suspend US investment
summary: 'It is clear that if a large French company agrees to open a factory in the United States, it would give the Americans a point,' Finance and Economy Minister Eric Lombard said.

title: Future House of African Worlds struggles to establish itself in Paris
summary: Just months before its opening in a temporary space in eastern Paris, the MansA, envisioned by President Emmanuel Macron, is still awaiting funding from the Ministry of Culture.

title: What does France export to the US?
summary: Certain French sectors are especially reliant on exports to the United States and risk being hit hard by the 20% tariffs announced by Donald Trump on Wednesday.

title: Figurative art back in force at Art Paris fair
summary: The 27th edition of the fair, held at the Grand Palais in Paris until April 6, has a large selection of galleries showing diverse artworks – with figurative art back in force.

title: Macron tries to unite French industries in the face of new US tariffs
summary: The French president criticized Donald Trump's abrupt imposition of tariffs and called on French businesses to suspend investments in the US while talks are ongoing.

title: British comedian and actor Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault
summary: Brand was charged with one count of rape, indecent assault and oral rape as well as two counts of sexual assault, said London's Metropolitan police on Friday.
